content: I'm sure there is a statement somewhere about it, but what is the expected behavior of extensions when a Resource summary (or selected elements) are returned? Do I get no extensions, the extensions on the returned elements, or all extensions?
The extension element definition at https://www.hl7.org/fhir/domainresource.html doesn't have the Σ flag, which implies to me that they can be left out. Except modifier extensions I guess.
I think there's a change request to make sure that modifierExtension gets the Σ flag, so it should be a simple matter of just looking for the Σ flag.

Should fields marked with a I (constraint/invariant) be included in summary? Case in example, NutritionOrder which has oralDiet, supplement and enteralFormula which have the constraint flag but have children with the summary/Σ flag.
In addition, what is the behavior of _summary=count searches for resources requested in _include/_revinclude?

Sorry another question regarding _summary: considering Observation.related which is marked as summary field but none of its children are marked as summary fields. So should this indicate to return all children?
I really appreciate any responses. Thanks in advance.

summary is explicit, only those marked with the summary flag should be included, and the returned resource should be marked with the subsetted tag. (as noted here)
http://hl7.org/fhir/2016Sep/search.html#summary
Invariants don't matter here, and edits really shouldn't be done on subsetted content, as posting it back as an update would wipe out any values in non summary properties.

As for the summary=count, this just means that the entries collection is not returned.
The Bundle.Total property contains a value that represents the number of the resource you are searching for, and excludes any _include or _revinclude resources. As per spec here:
http://hl7.org/fhir/2016Sep/search.html#count
Thanks a lot for the response. If the parent field is not marked as summary field, then its children, despite being summary, will not be returned in summaries right?
